meanings.definition: The act of grouping or combining items together for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The groupage of boxes made it easier to load the truck.
meanings.sent2: The company used groupage to save space in the delivery van.
meanings.sent3: During the move, the groupage of furniture turned into a fun puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her organizing skills were like the smooth groupage of a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The groupage of books on the shelf created a neat and tidy display.

meanings.definition: A shipment of goods that are grouped together for shipping.
meanings.sent1: The groupage of products arrived at the warehouse on time.
meanings.sent2: The logistics company specializes in efficient groupage services.
meanings.sent3: The groupage of packages looked like a colorful tower.
meanings.sent4: The groupage of items resembled a tightly packed treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The groupage of parcels was carefully labeled for easy identification.

meanings.definition: The process of organizing people or things into a group.
meanings.sent1: Her groupage of students into teams was well thought out.
meanings.sent2: The groupage of volunteers made the event run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The groupage of toys in the playroom led to a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The groupage of colors in the painting created a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The groupage of ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious meal.
